clinical_study.brief_title: Statement of Care of Anemia in Delivering Patients at Nord Franche-Comte Hospital
clinical_study.official_title: Statement of Care of Anemia in Delivering Patients at Nord Franche-Comte Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Anemia is a common pregnancy condition that has multiple origins. Its frequency and severity seem to be increasing, despite the existing management recommendations and the awareness of health professionals. The objective of this study is to make a statement of this pathology within our establishment, to evaluate the proportion of patients presenting this pathology and to highlight possible risk factors.

primary_outcome.measure: Estimation of the proportion of patients presenting anemia during delivery
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients with hemoglobin less than 10.5 g/dl at entry into the delivery room

secondary_outcome.measure: Risk factors underlying anemia during delivery with a large questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Link between presence or absence of anemia and type of follow-up (gynecological or midwife, anemia during pregnancy and iron supplementation strategy and compliance), living conditions (geographical origin, socioeconomic situation, diet) and comorbidities

study_pop.textblock: All patients presenting eligibility criteria and giving birth at NFC Hospital

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- > 18 years
- Delivery at Nord Franche-Comte Hospital
- Delivery ≥ 32 weeks of amenorrhea
- Informed patient and non-opposition of participation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Protected adults (Patients under guardianship, curatorship, safeguard of justice or under family authorization)
- Medical interruption of pregnancy
- Patients with fetal death in utero or neonatal death
- Minor patients
- Premature delivery before 32 weeks
